messages.content:
Hi, I am Plugin Pal - your WordPress plugin assistant!
 To begin, please describe the plugin you want to create.
Can you make a plugin to show a notice that only admins may  edit

Got it. Should this notice appear only on the dashboard editing screens, or also site‑wide or on the front end? Do you want it shown to all non-admin logged-in users, and is the default text “Only administrators may edit” okay, always visible (not dismissible)?

requirements.name: Admin Edit Notice
requirements.description: Shows a notice that only admins may edit.
requirements.details: Display a clear notice to non-admin users indicating that only administrators may edit. By default, show a prominent banner at the top of content editing screens in the dashboard (e.g., post/page editor) for any logged-in user who is not an Administrator. The plugin does not change permissions or block editing; it only shows the notice. Default message: “Only administrators may edit.” The notice is always visible (not dismissible).

messages.content: I want it to be like a notcieboard from admin and i can paset via shortcode

Great—I'll set up an admin noticeboard you can paste into any page or post with a small tag. Quick check: do you want just one message or a list of multiple messages, and should it show to everyone or only logged‑in users?

requirements.name: Noticeboard Widget
requirements.description: Admin-managed noticeboard that you can place anywhere.
requirements.details: Provide a simple noticeboard that site admins can manage from the dashboard and display anywhere using a small tag placed in content. Include a settings screen for admins with fields for a notice title and message, and a toggle to enable/disable display. The front-end output shows a simple styled box with the title (if set) and message. By default, the notice shows to all visitors. Only admins can edit the notice. Keep styling minimal and neutral, with a prominent header and body text.
